DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Populating a Domain Ontology from Web Historical Dictionaries and Encyclopedias
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Populating a Domain Ontology from Web Historical Dictionaries and Encyclopedias

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Euro American Conference on Telematics and Information Systems
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 2007 Euro American conference on Telematics and information systems 2008

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: An increasing volume of information is available on the web and usually is expressed as text, representing unstructured or semi-structured data. Thus, semantic information is implicit in these texts, since they are mainly intended for human consumption and interpretation. Therefore, it is not easy to automatically identify concepts or establish relations among them inside the texts. In particular, some web sites contain information on historical data about artistic manifestations like literature or music. This kind of site contains a body of knowledge on the domain, and usually is constructed with some format and content patterns that may be useful for information extraction. In order to make this information available as a structured knowledge base, an information extraction process is necessary. Ontologies are an appropriate way to represent structured knowledge bases, enabling sharing, reuse and inference. In this paper, it is described an information extraction process cycle for populating a domain ontology using texts available on the internet to extract instances of concepts, events and relations, based on existing ontology development methodologies and information extraction techniques. Through this process, latent concepts and relations expressed in natural language can be extracted and represented as an ontology, allowing new uses of the available content. A case study that applies this process is presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Using OWL to Represent Metadata of Multimedia Learning Objects
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Using OWL to Represent Metadata of Multimedia Learning Objects

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Sistemas Multimdia e Web (WEBMEDIA)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The continuous development of the information and communication technologies makes possible the use of new strategies to support learning processes. In addition, there is an increasingly large number of worldwide available content, which could be used as learning materials. However, in spite of offering an inexhaustible source for search processes, this large number of content makes difficult to find a specific material, appropriated to a particular need. So, the work presented in this paper aims at providing a formal and more comprehensive description of the content embedded in Multimedia Learning Objects (MLOs) through complementary groups of metadata with focus in educational and multimedia properties. Thus, parts of the LOM and MPEG-7 metadata standards, both of them represented in OWL, were used in an architecture of multimedia LO description. This paper argues that through these standards it is possible to describe MLOs in a more appropriate way, increasing the retrieval effectiveness of users? searches and improving the reuse potential of these materials. Moreover, through OWL it is possible to build conceptual links between different multimedia resources as well as perform inference tasks and automatically discovering relationships between them. A prototype and a case study present the functionality of the proposed architecture.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The continuous development of the information and communication technologies makes possible the use of new strategies to support learning processes. In addition, there is an increasingly large number of worldwide available content, which could be used as learning materials. However, in spite of offering an inexhaustible source for search processes, this large number of content makes difficult to find a specific material, appropriated to a particular need. So, the work presented in this paper aims at providing a formal and more comprehensive description of the content embedded in Multimedia Learning Objects (MLOs) through complementary groups of metadata with focus in educational and multimedia properties. Thus, parts of the LOM and MPEG-7 metadata standards, both of them represented in OWL, were used in an architecture of multimedia LO description. This paper argues that through these standards it is possible to describe MLOs in a more appropriate way, increasing the retrieval effectiveness of users? searches and improving the reuse potential of these materials. Moreover, through OWL it is possible to build conceptual links between different multimedia resources as well as perform inference tasks and automatically discovering relationships between them. A prototype and a case study present the functionality of the proposed architecture.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Agregao Inteligente de RSS utilizando uma taxonomia construda colaborativamente
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Intelligent RSS aggregation based on a collaborative construction of a taxonomy

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Workshop de Teses e Dissertaes (WTD 2008) do WebMedia

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A agregao contnua de contedo na forma de RSS faz o usurio se deparar com problemas causados pelo excesso de informao, como a recuperao de informao de baixa relevncia e o consumo de contedos que informam o mesmo fato. Por isso, os agregadores inteligentes de RSS procuram capturar os interesses do usurio a fim de agregar apenas informao relevante, aplicando-se algum tipo de classificao e filtragem ao processo de agregao. Nesse contexto, o processo de agregao inteligente de RSS descrito neste trabalho tem como premissa o emprego da colaborao na construo de uma taxonomia com termos e conceitos extrados do RSS, permitindo ao usurio a escolha de assuntos considerados relevantes a serem utilizados na agregao. A validao deste processo ainda depende do desenvolvimento de um prottipo e da realizao de um estudo de caso com usurios, objetivando a verificao da qualidade do contedo agregado.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Continuous RSS content aggregation makes users to face problems caused by excess of information, such as the retrieval of low relevant items and the repetitive consumption of information about the same fact. That?s why intelligent RSS aggregators try to capture user wishes, applying content filtering and classification to aggregate only relevant information during the aggregation process. In this context, the intelligent aggregation process here described has the premise of using collaboration to construct a taxonomy of the terms and concepts extracted from the RSS items, allowing the user to select relevant subjects for aggregation. The validation of this process still depends on the development of a prototype and the analysis of the results of a case study to verify the quality of the aggregated content.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Cenrios de Segmentao de Contedo e Construo de Objetos de Aprendizagem
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Scenaries of Content Segmentation and Learning Objects' Construction

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simposio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XIX Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao (SBIE 2008)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O desenvolvimento de materiais de aprendizagem, principalmente os que incorporam multimdia, visto como um processo caro e demorado. Assim, h um enorme interesse na reutilizao de tais materiais. Entretanto, eles atualmente so estruturados como arquivos multimdia e, portanto, seu reuso se d como um todo, limitando a sua aplicao e o retorno de seu investimento. Para ultrapassar tais limitaes, este artigo prope que usurios promovam a reutilizao do contedo destes materiais atravs de sua estruturao em segmentos semanticamente reutilizveis. Alguns cenrios onde a aplicao desta abordagem pode ser considerada so apresentados.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The development of learning materials, mainly the ones that incorporate multimedia, is seen as an expensive and time-consuming process. Thus, there is a great interest on the reuse of these materials. However, nowadays, they are structured as multimedia files and, therefore, the reuse implies on reusing the whole file, which limits its application and the return on investment. So, the work presented in this paper proposes that the users promote the reuse of content embedded in these materials by structuring them into reusable semantic segments. Some scenarios where the application of this approach can be considered are presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Using Metadata Standards Represented in OWL for Retrieving LOs? Content
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Using Metadata Standards Represented in OWL for Retrieving LOs? Content

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Brazilian Workshop on Semantic Web and Education (WSWEd)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: There is a great interest on the reuse of learning materials. However, nowadays, they are structured as multimedia files and, therefore, retrieving a specific material means retrieving the whole file, even though it could be desirable to access and use only parts of these materials. So, this paper proposes an ontology based on the metadata standards LOM and MPEG-7 for LOs? content description, in order to retrieve specific parts of content embedded in LOs. Using LOM and MPEG-7 allows describing educational and multimedia characteristics while an ontology allows retrieving through graph navigation as well as the exploration of inferred relationships.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Guiding Asynchronous Argumentation in Collaborative Learning through the Use of Ontologies
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Guiding Asynchronous Argumentation in Collaborative Learning through the Use of Ontologie

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Brazilian Workshop on Semantic Web and Education (WSWEd)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Categorizing messages in asynchronous communication tools such as forums provides understanding of the relations between messages without having to inspect their content, helping to identify the direction that the discussion is taking. However, choosing the right category for a message is not so easy. In addition, in discussion forums, communication follows a hierarchical structure, which means sequencing messages as trees. In some scenarios though, more elaborated representations are necessary, relating messages from different hierarchies, i.e. a graph oriented approach. In this paper a work for guiding asynchronous argumentation in collaborative learning through the use of ontologies is presented. The proposed approach allows messages categorization guidance and graph message chaining.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Categorizing messages in asynchronous communication tools such as forums provides understanding of the relations between messages without having to inspect their content, helping to identify the direction that the discussion is taking. However, choosing the right category for a message is not so easy. In addition, in discussion forums, communication follows a hierarchical structure, which means sequencing messages as trees. In some scenarios though, more elaborated representations are necessary, relating messages from different hierarchies, i.e. a graph oriented approach. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Treatment of the evolution of ontologies based on negotiation techniques to support collaborative environments
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Treatment of the evolution of ontologies based on negotiation techniques to support collaborative environments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 12th International Symposium on the Management of Industrial and Corporate Knowledge (ISMICK'08)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XII International Symposium on the management of industrial and Corporate Knowledge

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Ontologies, as knowledge representation of a domain, can have their structures altered, whether through a new understanding of the domain or through modelling towards a certain emerging need in the company. The maintenance of such a change in the ontology includes its compatibility with newer and previous-version of the ontology and, especially, its propagation to the applications that use it. However, in a collaborative environment, changes made by different software agents can conflict, in a semantic way, causing inconsistency to the ontology. Negotiation techniques are adequate in this context as they provide a formal communication protocol towards the consensus of divergent conceptualizations. This work deals with the creation of a framework that supports meaning negotiation for the evolution of the ontologies. It is based on formal ontological constructs, applicable in collaborative environments.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Ontologies, as knowledge representation of a domain, can have their structures altered, whether through a new understanding of the domain or through modelling towards a certain emerging need in the company. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: An Ontology-Driven Model for Semantic Negotiation on Metadata
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: An Ontology-Driven Model for Semantic Negotiation on Metadata

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 12th International Symposium on the Management of Industrial and Corporate Knowledge (ISMICK'08)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XII International Symposium on the management of industrial and Corporate Knowledge

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Business Intelligence technologies are turned more and more important to decision making processes on enterprises. Data capturing, retrieving, and integrating are tasks that perform crucial roles to prepare the information for later analysis and, consequently, decision making. Nevertheless, semantic matters, like ambiguity or terminology conflict, frequently arise when dealing with data derived from different sources. This work proposes a model, formalized as an ontology, to systematize the negotiation between agents, responsible to establish semantic consensus, concerning to the metadata associated to data sources. Such agreement can be used to implement automatization of the tasks mentioned above, very common on many corporate applications, as the development of the ETL process, the most expensive part of data warehousing projects.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Business Intelligence technologies are turned more and more important to decision making processes on enterprises. Data capturing, retrieving, and integrating are tasks that perform crucial roles to prepare the information for later analysis and, consequently, decision making. Nevertheless, semantic matters, like ambiguity or terminology conflict, frequently arise when dealing with data derived from different sources. This work proposes a model, formalized as an ontology, to systematize the negotiation between agents, responsible to establish semantic consensus, concerning to the metadata associated to data sources. Such agreement can be used to implement automatization of the tasks mentioned above, very common on many corporate applications, as the development of the ETL process, the most expensive part of data warehousing projects.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Uma metodologia de avaliao de ferramentas de gesto de ontologias
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Metodology for evaluating tools for ontology management

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Seminrio de Pesquisa em Ontologia no Brasil
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Seminrio de Pesquisa em Ontologia no Brasil

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Tecnologias semnticas esto cada vez mais sendo utilizadas em ambientes corporativos, onde ontologias tornam-se mais abrangentes e complexas. Consequentemente, a gesto de ontologias se torna tambm mais complexa, necessitando de ferramentas e metodologias de apoio. No entanto, a grande quantidade de ferramentas desenvolvidas segundo caractersticas especficas dificulta a seleo de ferramentas para a gesto adequada de ontologias. Este trabalho prope uma metodologia para avaliao de ferramentas para gesto de ontologias composta de passos e critrios de pontuao para seleo de ferramentas. A proposta est sendo empregada em um cenrio real, em uma grande empresa brasileira.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The use of semantic technologies is growing in TI projects in enterprises, where ontologies become bigger and complex. Consequently, ontology management becomes more complex, requiring tools and methodologies. However, existing tools are developed according with specific characteristics, which makes a big challenge to choose a tool for ontology management. This article proposes a methodology for evaluating ontology management tools. This methodology is composed by a set of steps for selecting candidate tools and a set of criteria to scoring these tools. This proposal is experimented in a real scenario in a big Brazilian company.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Populating a Domain Ontology from a Web Biographical Dictionary of Music - An Unsupervised Rule-based Method to Handle Brazilian Portuguese Texts
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Populating a Domain Ontology from a Web Biographical Dictionary of Music - An Unsupervised Rule-based Method to Handle Brazilian Portuguese Texts

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Web Information Systems and Technologies (WEBIST)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the Fifth International Conference on Web Information Systems and Technologies

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Evaluating the Reuse of Learning Content through a Segmentation Approach
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Evaluating the Reuse of Learning Content through a Segmentation Approach

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Advanced Learning Technologies (ICALT)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: There is an increasingly number of worldwide available content on the Web, which could be reused to support learning processes. However, Web content is getting more and more structured as multimedia files and reusing it implies on using the whole file, which limits its applicability and the return on investment of its development. So, an interesting approach is the segmentation of content, structuring it on reusable segments. Furthermore, once created, these segments can be reused in an easy way in different educational contexts. This paper discusses the segmentation process and presents the results obtained from a case study conducted using a prototype to evaluate this approach.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: There is an increasingly number of worldwide available content on the Web, which could be reused to support learning processes. However, Web content is getting more and more structured as multimedia files and reusing it implies on using the whole file, which limits its applicability and the return on investment of its development. So, an interesting approach is the segmentation of content, structuring it on reusable segments. Furthermore, once created, these segments can be reused in an easy way in different educational contexts. This paper discusses the segmentation process and presents the results obtained from a case study conducted using a prototype to evaluate this approach.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Enterprise Ontology Management: An Approach Based on Information Architecture
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Enterprise Ontology Management: An Approach Based on Information Architecture

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Enterprise Information Systems (ICEIS)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Information Systems Analysis and Specification

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Ontologies have gained popularity, but its promises of being a key point to the solution of real-world problems and mitigating interoperability problems at a large scale have not yet been accomplished. Ontology management is at the kernel of this evolution, and there is a lack of adequate strategies and mechanisms for handling it in such a way to contribute to a better alignment between business and IT. This work proposes an approach for enterprise ontology management as part of an Information Architecture initiative. This approach provides a more complete foundation of the ontology lifecycle while guiding the enterprise in this management, by defining a set of processes, roles and competencies required for ontology management. It was applied to a big enterprise in Brazil at the Data Integration department.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Ontologies have gained popularity, but its promises of being a key point to the solution of real-world problems and mitigating interoperability problems at a large scale have not yet been accomplished. Ontology management is at the kernel of this evolution, and there is a lack of adequate strategies and mechanisms for handling it in such a way to contribute to a better alignment between business and IT. This work proposes an approach for enterprise ontology management as part of an Information Architecture initiative. This approach provides a more complete foundation of the ontology lifecycle while guiding the enterprise in this management, by defining a set of processes, roles and competencies required for ontology management. It was applied to a big enterprise in Brazil at the Data Integration department.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Learning by Sharing Instructional Segments
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Learning by Sharing Instructional Segments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: World Summit on the Knowledge Society
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Lecture Notes in Computer Science

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Workers in the Knowledge Society need to think creatively, solve problems, and make decisions as a team. Therefore, the development and enhancement of skills for teamwork through collaborative learning is one of the main goals of nowadays education. The term ?collaborative learning" refers to an instructional approach in which students work together in groups toward a common goal. The present research was designed to evaluate the effectiveness of a collaborative learning approach where groups of students were involved in the creation of instructional content through the reuse of existing videos that could be segmented according to their needs. The experience was based on the use of a prototype supporting the collaborative activities and facilitating the creation, sequencing and presentation of video segments. Student?s perceptions of the learning experience were evaluated and findings are presented as well as suggestions for further research.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Music is a complex domain with some interesting specificities that makes it difficult to be modeled. If different types of music are considered, then the difficulties are even bigger. This paper presents some of the characteristics that makes music such a hard domain to model and proposes an ontology for representing musical phonographic records. This ontology will provide a global representation that can be used to support systems interoperability and data integration, which provides disseminating music worldwide, contributing to culture in the knowledge society.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In order to perform its tasks on the semantic web, software agents must be able to communicate with other agents using domain ontologies, even when considering different ontologies. Thus, it?s necessary to address the semantic interoperability issue to enable agents to recognize common concepts and misunderstandings. This work proposes the use of negotiation concepts in business scenarios for addressing concept compatibilization problems in communication between software agents. Negotiation techniques are suitable in this context by providing a formal communication protocol useful for reaching conceptualization consensus. An architecture is proposed, with modules that encapsulate these negotiation concepts.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo visa apresentar os trabalhos relacionados a Ontologias, do Ncleo de Pesquisa e Prtica em Tecnologia (NP2Tec) da UNIRIO*, incluindo trabalhos desenvolvidos e em andamento, bem como as contribuies esperadas, experincia e perfil do grupo e as direes de pesquisa. O enfoque dos trabalhos est na integrao de temas como Gesto e Engenharia de Ontologias com Modelagem de Processos de Negcio e Arquitetura Empresarial, em especial a Arquitetura de Informao. Algumas das frentes de pesquisa esto sendo realizadas em colaborao com o Ncleo de Estudos em Modelagem Conceitual e Ontologias (NEMO) da UFES?. O trabalho do grupo envolve pesquisas nestes assuntos, mas tambm como estas pesquisas podem ser aplicadas e contribuir com a TI de organizaes, de modo a alavancar seus negcios.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Comunicao em Blog: Estruturao do Discurso e Relao entre os Participantes
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Communication in Blogs: Structuring Speech and the Relationship among the Participants

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Sistemas Colaborativos (SBSC), 6

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nesta ltima dcada, o blog se popularizou e se consolidou como um importante sistema de comunicao. A pesquisa apresentada neste artigo contribui para a gerao de conhecimento sobre as caractersticas e o potencial do blog como meio de comunicao e interao. As possibilidades de comunicao em blog so analisadas em funo de duas perspectivas: estruturao do discurso e relao entre os participantes. No blog usada uma estruturao peculiar do discurso, a estrutura Grafo Estrela, que impe a organizao centralizada de mensagens que resulta numa discusso focada. So estabelecidas as seguintes relaes entre os participantes: Um-Todos, quando o autor publica a postagem; e Todos-Um, quando os vrios leitores comentam a postagem do autor. Estas duas formas de comunicao so centradas no autor. A relao Todos-Todos, que possibilita a interao entre todos os participantes, estabelecida indiretamente atravs das ligaes entre blogs, e tambm atravs do uso de um mecanismo para responder um comentrio que, contudo, descaracteriza a organizao centralizada de mensagens. Como resultado desta pesquisa, proposta uma estruturao do discurso que possibilita a relao Todos-Todos e mantm a estruturao centralizada: a Organizao Centralizada Enriquecida com Ligaes.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: It is possible to notice an increasing interest in educational contexts to use a collaborative approach to learning where students are able to interact and share information developing team competences. Furthermore, there is a huge amount of information available on the Web, which could be reused to support learning. But to take full advantage of this potential it is important to have mechanisms supporting semantic interoperability. However, it is difficult to integrate and share information that was developed using different vocabularies and different perspectives. This paper is a contribution to solve this problem and aims at exploring the benefits of using structured information in a collaborative learning approach. In order to structure information it is proposed the use of RDF. An example of providing semantic interoperability according to the proposed approach is presented.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: XXX Congresso da Sociedade Brasileira de Computao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste artigo, so apresentadas e comparadas dinmicas educacionais com o uso do blog como suporte a mtodos educacionais de Aprendizagem Colaborativa: Baseada em Problemas, Baseada em Projetos e Baseada em Discusso. A partir das experincias, identificou-se que o uso educacional do blog diferente de um blog tpico, o que indica a necessidade de customizar o sistema de blog para as dinmicas educacionais. Trs estratgias de levantamento de requisitos foram consideradas para a customizao de blogs educacionais: Anlise do Processo, Anlise dos Logs e Anlise do Discurso. As estratgias foram usadas para elicitar requisitos gerais de blogs educacionais e indicar a necessidade de se extrair requisitos especficos em funo do processo e do contexto especfico de cada projeto de dinmica educacional.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Sequencing Concepts for Supporting an E-Learning Class: An Approach Based on Ontologies and the Structure of Signs
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Sequencing Concepts for Supporting an E-Learning Class: An Approach Based on Ontologies and the Structure of Signs

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IADIS WWW/Internet

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Learning objects have been used in e-learning with the objective of allowing reuse content material. However, this approach also demands getting the right pieces of content and assembling them together in order to build a semantically richer instructional material. In order to guide this combination of the right content, it is necessary to define sequences of topics to be covered and then the files to be used as learning objects. In this paper we discuss Learning Object composition and sequencing from suggestions taken from Knowledge Domain Modeling. We propose the use of a domain ontology for allowing the suggestion of sequences of topics to be covered, which is also based on some concepts of Semiotics and Linguistics applied to multimedia narrative structures. Learning environment and the teacher action is represented as an enactment where educational resources have a role similar to actors in a play. So, the unfolding of a lesson is conceived as a narrative, like storytelling, so that the elements are assembled in a discourse. A representation of the Knowledge Domain is coined as ontology represented by means of OWL DL and the relevant concepts are arranged in a list extracted from the representative graph of the domain. From this list of topics, the user can chose the most adequate corresponding learning objects to be used in a class or learning scenario. The proposal was validated with domain specialists and the results are also discussed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Composition of Learning Objects based on their Formal Aspects of Expression

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao (SBIE)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do ... Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A composio e sequenciamento de Objetos de Aprendizagem so discutidas neste trabalho a partir da representao da estrutura conceitual de um domnio em termos das suas relaes de dependncia. A composio de Objetos de Aprendizagem modelada a partir da estrutura narrativa de um discurso considerando-se os aspetos formais dos planos do contedo e de expresso. O aspecto formal do contedo da composio dado pelas pelos conceitos e seus relacionamentos e forma da expresso corresponde aos tipos de signos definidos pelo LOM. A estrutura da composio obtida independe do tipo de mdia utilizado e o modelo adqua-se s propostas de composio adaptativas tanto do ponto de vista do meio como das disponibilidades de conexo.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Composition and sequencing of Learning Objects are discussed in this paper through the representation of the conceptual structure of a domain in terms of its dependence relationships. The composition of Learning Objects is modeled from the narrative structure of a discourse considering the formal aspects of content and expression plans. The formal aspect of the content of a composition is given by the concepts and their relationships while the form of expression is given by the types of signs defined in LOM. The resulting composition structure is independent of the media type. This approach fits to adaptative composition proposals of Learning Objects both from the standpoint of the media and network requirements.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Composio de Objetos de Aprendizagem com base na Decomposio do Grafo do Domnio de Conhecimento: Aplicao em Subdomnio da Mecnica
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Composing Learning Objects through the decomposition of knowledge domain graph: Application in a Mechanics subdomain

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Conferncia Ibero-Americana IADIS WWW/Internet

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A busca e composio de recursos de aprendizagem a partir de repositrios uma tarefa que demanda tempo e ainda no existe uma sugesto direta de como organizar uma sequncia de aprendizagem. A busca processada a partir de palavras-chave associadas aos conceitos mais importantes, no havendo, contudo, garantias de que os conceitos relacionados sejam tambm recuperados. Neste trabalho, um mecanismo de busca e composio de objetos de aprendizagem proposto por intermdio do relacionamento entre conceitos. O domnio de conhecimento representado por meio da sua representao semntica. Uma rede conceitual gerada desta representao e a sua decomposio a partir das propriedades das redes complexas. Partimos da hiptese de que esta rede conceitual possa ser modelada como uma rede livre de escala e um mecanismo recursivo de decomposio da rede em subredes e que so identificadas com subdomnios do conhecimento de tal forma que a busca pode ser feita por intermdio do uso conveniente de metadados. Um teste em um pequeno subdomnio da Fsica introdutria discutido como uma demonstrao da viabilidade deste procedimento.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Collaborative Mobile Approach for Business Process Elicitation
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Collaborative Mobile Approach for Business Process Elicitation

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Computer Supported Cooperative Work in Design (CSCWD)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Collaborative techniques for business process design are generally supported by groupware tools that allow process actors to interact collecting their knowledge about the activities performed. Despite success reports, challenges are still observed due to the complexity of this task. We propose to gather benefits of interviews, collaboration and visual methods in eliciting business processes in order to deal with problems identified in literature. We present an approach based on a collaborative mobile application which analysts should use while interviewing process stakeholders. The information is collected through a simple BPMN diagram through which they exchange information and build parts of the models.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Collaborative techniques for business process design are generally supported by groupware tools that allow process actors to interact collecting their knowledge about the activities performed. Despite success reports, challenges are still observed due to the complexity of this task. We propose to gather benefits of interviews, collaboration and visual methods in eliciting business processes in order to deal with problems identified in literature. We present an approach based on a collaborative mobile application which analysts should use while interviewing process stakeholders. The information is collected through a simple BPMN diagram through which they exchange information and build parts of the models.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Sequencing Learning Objects: space-time, semiotic and pedagogical constraints
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Sequencing Learning Objects: space-time, semiotic and pedagogical constraints

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Advanced Learning Technologies (ICALT)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Learning Object composition model based on semiotic aspects of narrative is proposed with the specification of space, time and semiotic constraints. Learning objects are considered as signs, since they convey meaning through a physical support. Space, time, semiotic and pedagogical requirements are addressed to satisfy constraints in order to prevent overlapping medias so that the cognitive load can be reduced.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A Learning Object composition model based on semiotic aspects of narrative is proposed with the specification of space, time and semiotic constraints. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Using educational resources to improve the efficiency of Web searches for additional learning material
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Using educational resources to improve the efficiency of Web searches for additional learning material

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Advanced Learning Technologies (ICALT)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Internet is an invaluable source of information that can and should be used to help education. One of the possibilities of Internet in this area is the search for resources that complement the learning process, usually done with the support of the search engines. This search is generally performed using keywords, which implies on contextless results. This work uses information extraction techniques applied to educational resources to expand the queries done by students, adding contextual information in the search and thus recovering more appropriate educational resources. A prototype was developed according to the proposed architecture and a case study conducted in a Brazilian university presented results showing that this proposal can be used in an educational environment to improve the search of educational resources.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Internet is an invaluable source of information that can and should be used to help education. One of the possibilities of Internet in this area is the search for resources that complement the learning process, usually done with the support of the search engines. This search is generally performed using keywords, which implies on contextless results. This work uses information extraction techniques applied to educational resources to expand the queries done by students, adding contextual information in the search and thus recovering more appropriate educational resources. A prototype was developed according to the proposed architecture and a case study conducted in a Brazilian university presented results showing that this proposal can be used in an educational environment to improve the search of educational resources.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Qualidade dos Dados nas Organizaes sob o Enfoque de Apoio a Deciso: Um estudo exploratrio
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Data Quality in Organizations with Focus on Decision Support: An Exploratory Study

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Sistemas de Informao (SBSI)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Entender como os profissionais da empresa esto lidando com os dados e como enxergam a qualidade dos dados crucial para se traar estratgias de gerncia desta qualidade. Atravs de um formulrio online buscou-se observar como os profissionais de TI esto lidando com a questo da qualidade dos dados, principalmente os que esto envolvidos em projetos de apoio deciso e se existe a necessidade de apoiar essas equipes em atividades relacionadas gerncia da qualidade e explicitao de critrios de qualidade nos dados. Dentre os resultados obtidos, a pesquisa evidenciou a necessidade da insero de projetos relacionados qualidade de dados dentro de um programa de Governana de Dados
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Understanding how the professionals of the organization are dealing with data and how they perceive data quality is crucial to define strategies for managing this quality. Through an online form, it was possible to observe how IT professionals are dealing with data quality, particularly those involved in decision support projects and if there is a need for supporting those team in activities related to data quality management and making quality criteria explicit in data. From the results, the research also pointed out the need for considering data quality projects in a program for data governance.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: O Papel da Semntica no Business Intelligence 2.0: Um Exemplo no Contexto de um Programa de Ps-Graduao
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: The Role of Semantics on Business Intelligence 2.0: An Example on the Context of a Pos-Graduate Program

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Sistemas de Informao (SBSI)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Um dos maiores problemas encontrados no Business Intelligence atual a latncia entre o acontecimento de um evento e a tomada de deciso. Novos conceitos que justificam a utilizao do novo termo BI 2.0 prometem reduzir esta latncia. Neste trabalho apresentado um sistema semntico de suporte deciso baseado em ontologias OWL, regras SWRL e na linguagem de consultas SQWRL, demonstrando como a aplicao de tecnologias da Web Semntica pode tornar os sistemas de BI mais aderentes ao negcio, apoiando, desta forma, decises mais rpidas e relevantes para a Organizao.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: One of the biggest problems in BI nowadays is the latency between the occurrence of an event and the decision made. New concepts that justify the use of the term BI 2.0 promise to reduce such latency. In this work, a semantic system for decision support is presented. It is based on OWL ontologies, SWRL rules and SQWRL query language, showing how the use of Web Semantic technologies can make BI systems more adherent to the business, this way supporting faster and more relevant decisions to the Organization.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Learning Object Composition: the role of Sign Types
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Learning Object Composition: the role of Sign Types: the role of Sign

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Americas Conference on Information Systems (AMCIS)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Learning objects are considered as complex signs, since they convey meaning through a physical support and are related to real or conceptual object. In addition, it is possible to define a sequence of learning objects that can be modeled as having a narrative structure the advantage of this proposal is that, from the structural theory of narrative, content and expression can be treated separately so that a composition model can be devised independently of the specific media employed to express them. Learning objects are expressed by means of heterogeneous media types that have spatial, temporal and semiotic aspects. These attributes impose space, time and semiotic constraints on this sequence that can influence pedagogical aspects producing a cognitive overload because different media types engage different perceptional channels (e.g. visual, auditive) and determine the way information is processed. The discussion on these features of learning objects composition is illustrated by some examples stressing the benefits of the proposed approach.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Learning objects are considered as complex signs, since they convey meaning through a physical support and are related to real or conceptual object. In addition, it is possible to define a sequence of learning objects that can be modeled as having a narrative structure the advantage of this proposal is that, from the structural theory of narrative, content and expression can be treated separately so that a composition model can be devised independently of the specific media employed to express them. Learning objects are expressed by means of heterogeneous media types that have spatial, temporal and semiotic aspects. These attributes impose space, time and semiotic constraints on this sequence that can influence pedagogical aspects producing a cognitive overload because different media types engage different perceptional channels (e.g. visual, auditive) and determine the way information is processed. The discussion on these features of learning objects composition is illustrated by some examples stressing the benefits of the proposed approach.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Contextual Query based on Segmentation and Clustering of Selected Documents for Acquiring Web Documents for Supporting Knowledge Management
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Contextual Query based on Segmentation and Clustering of Selected Documents for Acquiring Web Documents for Supporting Knowledge Management

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Americas Conference on Information Systems (AMCIS)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Internet is a valuable source of information whose volume of data and number of accesses grows every day. Web search engines have a key role in the discovery of relevant information, but this kind of search is usually performed using keywords and the results do not consider the context. This paper describes the use of information extraction techniques applied in previously defined resources in order to expand the queries made by users and run these expanded queries in web search engines, getting more useful search results, considering the domain context of the required information. A prototype was developed according to the proposed strategy and a case study was conducted in a Brazilian public institution. The results show that the proposed approach can be used in a corporative environment to help the execution of contextual search activities with good results.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The Internet is a valuable source of information whose volume of data and number of accesses grows every day. Web search engines have a key role in the discovery of relevant information, but this kind of search is usually performed using keywords and the results do not consider the context. A prototype was developed according to the proposed strategy and a case study was conducted in a Brazilian public institution. The results show that the proposed approach can be used in a corporative environment to help the execution of contextual search activities with good results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Blogs as User Based Social Networks for Learning: An Exploratory Study
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Blogs as User Based Social Networks for Learning: An Exploratory Study

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: World Summit on the Knowledge Society (WSKS 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nowadays social networks have a prominent place in human communication. Blogs are as user based social networks and its use in the context of formal learning can contribute to increase student?s motivation and to get better learning outcomes. This paper discusses message structuring on social networks and presents an exploratory study on the use of three different collaborative learning dynamics supported by blogs with groups of undergraduate and graduate students. Then, it also explores message structuring aspects in blogs in a collaborative learning dynamic.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nowadays social networks have a prominent place in human communication. Blogs are as user based social networks and its use in the context of formal learning can contribute to increase student?s motivation and to get better learning outcomes. This paper discusses message structuring on social networks and presents an exploratory study on the use of three different collaborative learning dynamics supported by blogs with groups of undergraduate and graduate students. Then, it also explores message structuring aspects in blogs in a collaborative learning dynamic.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Social Network for Sharing Learning Segments and Compositions
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Social Network for Sharing Learning Segments and Composions

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: World Summit on the Knowledge Society (WSKS 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The development of learning content using information technologies is an expensive, time-consuming and complex process. Therefore, it is important to consider reusing already developed instructional artifacts. This reuse approach is particularly interesting as it is observed that both teachers and learners perform searches for learning content, according to their needs and interests in order to create units ? or compositions ? of instructional content, aiming to accomplish a particular learning objective. Previous works discussed how the learners can learn from sharing instructional segments, but the composition of these segments is also important in the learning process. Therefore, in this paper different strategies for composition of learning segments are discussed and an educational social network oriented to instructional segments, is presented. A prototype was developed and a case study was performed in order to evaluate the proposed strategy.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The development of learning content using information technologies is an expensive, time-consuming and complex process. Therefore, it is important to consider reusing already developed instructional artifacts. This reuse approach is particularly interesting as it is observed that both teachers and learners perform searches for learning content, according to their needs and interests in order to create units ? or compositions ? of instructional content, aiming to accomplish a particular learning objective. Previous works discussed how the learners can learn from sharing instructional segments, but the composition of these segments is also important in the learning process. Therefore, in this paper different strategies for composition of learning segments are discussed and an educational social network oriented to instructional segments, is presented. A prototype was developed and a case study was performed in order to evaluate the proposed strategy.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Educao Musical Apoiada por Computador: Um Levantamento da Situao Atual e uma Proposta de Especializao de Ferramentas Existentes
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Computer-Supported Music Education: A Survey of Current Situation and a Proposal for Specializing Existing Tools

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Computao Musical (SBCM)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo aborda a posio dos educadores quanto a elementos que devem existir em ambientes de aprendizagem musical a distncia, faz um levantamento sobre as ferramentas j construdas, analisa os problemas levantados na literatura e comenta algumas solues j adotadas. Atravs de um estudo sobre a situao atual, constatado que alguns dos problemas ainda permanecem e aponta a especializao de ferramentas utilizadas nestes ambientes como uma possvel soluo.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This article discusses the position of educators about some elements that must exist in web based music instruction environments, makes a survey about tools for this kind of environment, examines some issues raised in the literature and discusses some solutions already adopted. Through a study about the actual situation, it is noticed that some problems remains and it is pointed that the specialization of the tools used in these environments may be a possible solution.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Anotao Semantica de Contedos Textuais presentes em Pginas Web e sua Recuperao
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Semantic Annotation and Retrieval of Textual Contents from Web Pages

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IADIS Ibero-Americana WWW/Internet 2011 (CIAWI 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho prope uma forma de apoiar usurios na anotao semntica de textos contidos em pginas web, permitindo sua recuperao segundo sua semntica e a exibio de contedos textuais. A soluo proposta se baseia em tecnologias da Web Semntica, utilizando-se de ontologias para representar conceitos de um domnio, permitindo classificaes dos arquivos textuais e facilitando o compartilhamento das informaes. Buscas com linguagem prxima linguagem natural so possibilitadas pelo uso do Jena e a partir da ontologia. Um exemplo demonstra a viabilidade da soluo.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Semantic Learning Object Composition: An Experiment based on the Theory of Discourse
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Semantic Learning Object Composition: An Experiment based on the Theory of Discourse

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IADIS WWW/Internet 2011 (ICWI 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A Learning Object composition process is proposed on the basis of structural theory of discourse whose form of content is the domain ontology expressed by the learning objects composition. The composition processed is based on the definition of a learning path from the domain ontology. Each concept in the learning path is mapped to a sequence of learning objects in a repository. The composition outcome is presented to the user in a way that is device independent relying on the emerging web technologies.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: A Learning Object composition process is proposed on the basis of structural theory of discourse whose form of content is the domain ontology expressed by the learning objects composition. The composition processed is based on the definition of a learning path from the domain ontology. Each concept in the learning path is mapped to a sequence of learning objects in a repository. The composition outcome is presented to the user in a way that is device independent relying on the emerging web technologies.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: An Agent-oriented System for Contextualized Web Queries
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: An Agent-oriented System for Contextualized Web Queries

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IADIS WWW/Internet 2011 (ICWI 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Web search engines play a key role in the discovery of accurate and relevant information. In general, search engines use only keywords for information retrieval, which implies on results that do not consider the context. This paper describes an agent-oriented architecture to manage the process of acquiring contextual information to be included in the original user web queries. In order to perform this, segmentation and clustering techniques are applied to the content that can provide the context (for example, documents or discussions). A prototype was developed considering content from the discussions generated in a collaborative community of a social network. A contextual query tool is available as an application for this same social network. Some results are summarized and presented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Web search engines play a key role in the discovery of accurate and relevant information. In general, search engines use only keywords for information retrieval, which implies on results that do not consider the context. This paper describes an agent-oriented architecture to manage the process of acquiring contextual information to be included in the original user web queries. In order to perform this, segmentation and clustering techniques are applied to the content that can provide the context (for example, documents or discussions). A prototype was developed considering content from the discussions generated in a collaborative community of a social network. A contextual query tool is available as an application for this same social network. Some results are summarized and presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: YouFlow: A Estruturao das Mensagens em Microblog promove a Interao?
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: YOUFLOW: Does the Message Structuring in Microblogs promote the Interaction?

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IADIS Ibero-Americana WWW/Internet 2011 (CIAWI 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Com o surgimento da web 2.0, o termo microblog se apresenta como uma nova forma de comunicao. Microblogs geralmente permitem a publicao de mensagens com uma quantidade de caracteres mxima (140 caracteres). Porm, como se d a estruturao entre mensagens correspondentes? Como tem sido explorada a visualizao de comentrios a uma resposta em ferramentas de microblog? Este artigo apresenta um resumo das principais formas de se estruturar o discurso em ferramentas de comunicao e as contextualiza em microblogs. Tambm descrito um microblog (YouFlow), desenvolvido para tratar a ligao entre as mensagens. Por fim, foi realizado um estudo de caso que mostrou que o tipo de estruturao do discurso em microblog pode influenciar na interao dos participantes da conversa.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Avaliao da aprendizagem apoiada na utilizao de mapas conceituais e alinhamento de ontologias
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Assessment of learning supported by the use of concept maps and alignment of ontologies

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Workshop Brasileiro de Web Semntica e Educao (SWEd?11@SBIE-WIE?11)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do ... Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Mapas Conceituais (MCs) so a principal ferramenta da teoria construtivista de Aprendizagem Significativa (AS). Assim como ontologias de domnio, mapas conceituais possibilitam a explicitao de conceitos e relacionamentos de um domnio. Neste artigo apresentamos um modelo de avaliao da aprendizagem. O modelo proposto apoiado na utilizao de mapas conceituais e em tcnicas de alinhamento de ontologias, respectivamente para explicitao da organizao de conceitos na estrutura cognitiva do aluno e para comparao automtica desses mapas com uma ontologia de referncia. Uma exemplo ilustrando essa aplicao apresentado e discutido.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Concept Maps are the main tool of the constructivist theory of Meaningful Learning. Just like domain ontologies, concept maps enable clarification of concepts and relationships of a domain. This article presents a learning assessment model supported by the use of concept maps and ontology alignment techniques, respectively for clarification of the organization of concepts in the student's cognitive structure and for the automatic comparison of these maps with a reference ontology. An example illustrating this application is presented and discussed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Estudo de Caso de Recomendao Semntica de Referncias em uma Disciplina de Mestrado
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Case Study of Semantic Recommendation for references on a Masters Course

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Workshop Brasileiro de Web Semntica e Educao (SWEd?11@SBIE-WIE?11)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do ... Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este artigo aborda o uso de Sistemas de Recomendao de referncias bibliogrficas por alunos em nvel de Mestrado. Usa-se inferncia lgica sobre um modelo ontolgico construdo e tambm sobre os indivduos nele contidos. A inferncia feita em cima dos dados do perfil do aluno que faz a consulta, atravs da seleo dos materiais recomendados ao seu perfil, adicionando ou excluindo recomendaes em funo da boa ou m avaliao realizada por alunos com perfil similar ao seu. Considera-se, ainda, as informaes da busca especfica fornecidas pelo aluno, como restries na consulta aos resultados at ento capturados. As concluses parecem indicar que Sistemas de Recomendao podem poupar tempo dos estudantes de Mestrado ao ajud-los a obter materiais relevantes ao seu propsito.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper describes the use of Recommendation Systems for bibliographical references by Masters graduates. Logical inference is used, based on a built ontology, considering data extracted from the student?s profile, selecting according material, aggregating or retrieving recommendations based on its good or bad evaluation by students with profile similar to the consultant?s. Specific search information provided is also considered, as restrictions to the results gathered. Conclusions seem to show that Recommendation Systems can save Masters students? time helping them to retrieve relevant material for their purpose.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Bate-papo para Educao
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Chats for Education

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Workshop on Applications to Provide Learning and Teaching Support (APPLETS)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do ... Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Neste artigo so apresentadas as pesquisas relacionadas ao sistemas de bate-papo desenvolvidos no contexto do projeto ComunicaTEC. O objetivo adaptar esse tipo de sistema para dar suporte a atividades educacionais especficas, tais como: entrevista, debate e discusso de contedos

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Ontological Representation and Learning of Enterprise Artifacts

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Ibero-American Meeting of Ontological Research 2011
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: VI Congresso Ibero-Americano de Telemtica (CITA 2011)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Planning Algorithm for Incorporating Attempts and Nondeterminism into Interactive Stories

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Tools with Artificial Intelligence (ICTAI)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In order to maintain their replay value and entertain the users, interactive storytelling systems demand the support of algorithms that, besides providing diversity of plots (without losing coherence) and possibilities of interaction, are capable of generating stories in a suitable amount of time, so that the user experience doesn?t result in frustration. In this context, automated planning algorithms are interesting alternatives, as they can create multiple plots that are coherent with the intended genre. A well established approach used to improve the performance of planners is the use of HTN planning techniques. In this paper, we present NDetHPlan, a general purpose planning algorithm that combines HTN and nondeterminism to cope with such requirements. The planner presented here can also deal with failed attempts to achieve goals, an especially valuable feature to create dramatic tension in the context of interactive storytelling. NDetHPlan has been incorporated to Logtell, a logic-based tool for interactive generation and dramatization of stories.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Need for Training? The Contextual Competence Model Will Tell You

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: World Summit on the Knowledge Society (WSKS 2012)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Utilizao de Ferramentas Colaborativas na Aprendizagem Musical de Alunos Leigos

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Workshop de Informtica na Escola
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do 18 Workshop de Informtica na Escola (WIE 2012)

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Automatic and Continuous Monitoring and Composition of Nondeterministic Web Services
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Automatic and Continuous Monitoring and Composition of Nondeterministic Web Services

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IADIS WWW/Internet

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Semantics & Learning
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Semantics & Learning

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Painel dos Grupos de Pesquisa em Informtica na Educao (PGPIE)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais dos Workshops do Congresso Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Recuperao Contextual de Informao na Web para Apoiar Aprendizagem Colaborativa em Redes Sociais

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do Simpsio Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Este trabalho considera que a relevncia na recuperao de documentos na Web pode ser primordial para estimular a colaborao em dinmicas de aprendizagem baseadas em discusso. Para melhorar e contextualizar a recuperao de documentos na Web, este artigo prope: (i) a modelagem do contexto a partir da extrao das mensagens em grupos de rede social e (ii) uso do contexto para melhorar a relevncia na recuperao de documentos na Web. Um estudo de caso demonstrou que a captura do contexto enriquecido usando mensagens de discusso pode melhorar a relevncia dos resultados das buscas na Web e contribuir com as discusses.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: YouFlow Microblog: Encouraging Discussions for Learning
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: YouFlow Microblog: Encouraging Discussions for Learning

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IADIS International Conference on e-Learning (e-Learning)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: IADIS Press - International Association for Development of the Information Society

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Microblogs have been used in the educational context. However, differently from following friends? status messages, in the educational scenario it is important to follow the discussions, to understand the flow of messages. YouFlow microblog was developed for that purpose. It is a microblog that provides the main structures of discourse that are available on communication systems as well as messages' categorization according to a lesson plan. An exploratory case study allowed analyzing the use of the structures of discourse on the microblog in an educational context. Then, an explanatory case study showed an increase in the participation on discussions of topics according to a lesson plan.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Microblogs have been used in the educational context. However, differently from following friends? status messages, in the educational scenario it is important to follow the discussions, to understand the flow of messages. YouFlow microblog was developed for that purpose. It is a microblog that provides the main structures of discourse that are available on communication systems as well as messages' categorization according to a lesson plan. An exploratory case study allowed analyzing the use of the structures of discourse on the microblog in an educational context. Then, an explanatory case study showed an increase in the participation on discussions of topics according to a lesson plan.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: YouFlow Microblog: Following Discussions on an Educational Microblog
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: YouFlow Microblog: Following Discussions on an Educational Microblog

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Advanced Learning Technologies

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Microblogs have been used in the educational context. However, differently from following friends? status messages, in the educational scenario it is important to follow the discussions, to understand the flow of messages. YouFlow microblog was developed for that purpose. It is a microblog that provides the main structures of discourse that are available on communication systems as well as messages' categorization according to a lesson plan. An exploratory case study allowed analyzing the use of the structures of discourse on the microblog in an educational context. Then, an explanatory case study showed an increase in the participation on discussions of topics according to a lesson plan.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Microblogs have been used in the educational context. An exploratory case study allowed analyzing the use of the structures of discourse on the microblog in an educational context. Then, an explanatory case study showed an increase in the participation on discussions of topics according to a lesson plan.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: LO-C(L)A(S)P: a Model for Supporting the Development of Learning Objects with Sound Manipulation and Social Resources for Music Education
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: LO-C(L)A(S)P: a Model for Supporting the Development of Learning Objects with Sound Manipulation and Social Resources for Music Education

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Americas Conference on Information Systems

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper we describe a model for supporting the development of learning objects that are closer to the music domain and to the student?s digital social reality. A case study considering a music education activity, which was created using the proposed model, was conducted with high school students to demonstrate the applicability and benefits of our approach. Results show the importance of considering the proposed model on guiding courseware development for music education. Moreover, it was noticed that students perceive social and sound integrated resources as important elements on their learning process.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper we describe a model for supporting the development of learning objects that are closer to the music domain and to the student?s digital social reality. Moreover, it was noticed that students perceive social and sound integrated resources as important elements on their learning process.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: A Case Study on Using Integrated Sound Resources for Music Education
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: A Case Study on Using Integrated Sound Resources for Music Education

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: World Summit on the Knowledge Society

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper we describe a case study conducted with high school students considering a music activity that was created using C(L)A(S)P concepts and integrating sound resources. Results show the importance of considering the integration approach for learning objects, especially on the music education context. We also noticed that the students seemed to be more motivated when using sound manipulation integrated resources.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Building Users Profiles Dynamically Through Analysis of Messages in Collaborative Systems

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference WWW/Internet

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Over the years the number of people accessing the web has considerably grown and exceeded 2 billion. Most of these hits come from collaborative systems or social networks like Facebook. In collaborative systems, the most important element is the user, because they help these systems to evolve and make better functionalities, so it?s crucial to know users deeply. Its possible to extract user?s information when he signs up on a collaborative system, but this information is rarely updated. This article presents a way to better understand these users by dynamically mapping their profiles through the explicitness of interests and preferences using text messages that are inserted spontaneously in a collaborative system as input. These messages are processed automatically to build three distinct types of user profiles based on the elements that are presented in these messages: the message text, links and hashtags. After conducting qualitative research through interviews with some users who have their profiles mapped on Twitter social network, results show that the approach was well accepted among these users and they believe that the built profile can represent them correctly.
