DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Finding Experts on Facebook Communities: Who Knows More?

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: WORLD SUMMIT ON THE KNOWLEDGE SOCIETY (WSKS)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 7th WORLD SUMMIT ON THE KNOWLEDGE SOCIETY

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Online communities have become important places for users to share and look for knowledge. In this context, this work aims to analyze computational methods that allow us to identify users with the highest expertise levels on a specific knowledge domain in an online community. In this study we analyzed a Java discussion group (online community) from Facebook. We tested some graph metrics and algorithms that are used in social network analysis in order to find the experts in this online community.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Online communities have become important places for users to share and look for knowledge. In this context, this work aims to analyze computational methods that allow us to identify users with the highest expertise levels on a specific knowledge domain in an online community. In this study we analyzed a Java discussion group (online community) from Facebook. We tested some graph metrics and algorithms that are used in social network analysis in order to find the experts in this online community.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Finding Reliable People in Online Communities of Questions and Answers - Analysis of Metrics and Scope Reduction
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Finding Reliable People in Online Communities of Questions and Answers - Analysis of Metrics and Scope Reduction

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: 16th International Conference on Enterprise Information Systems
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the 16th International Conference on Enterprise Information Systems
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DA-EDITORA: SCITEPRESS - Science and and Technology Publications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Online communities of questions and answers became important places for users to get information and share knowledge. We investigated metrics and strategies that allow the identification of users that are willing to help and provide good answers in a community, which we call the reliable people. In order to provide better performance on finding these users, we also raised some strategies for scope reduction. Then, we applied these metrics and strategies to three online communities of questions and answers available on the Web, which also provide user reputation grades, so it would be possible to verify the results on finding the reliable people.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Online communities of questions and answers became important places for users to get information and share knowledge. We investigated metrics and strategies that allow the identification of users that are willing to help and provide good answers in a community, which we call the reliable people. In order to provide better performance on finding these users, we also raised some strategies for scope reduction. Then, we applied these metrics and strategies to three online communities of questions and answers available on the Web, which also provide user reputation grades, so it would be possible to verify the results on finding the reliable people.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Encontrando Usurios Confiveis em Comunidades Online de Perguntas e Respostas Atravs de seu ndice de Confiana
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Finding Reliable Users in Online Communities of Questions and Answers through its Reliability Index

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Simpsio Brasileiro de Sistemas de Informao (SBSI)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: As comunidades online de perguntas e respostas se tornaram lugares importantes para usurios buscarem e compartilharem conhecimentos. Esse trabalho objetiva propor uma nova mtrica que permita identificar pessoas que tm maiores chances para dar uma boa resposta para uma pergunta em uma comunidade. No contexto do trabalho, essas pessoas so chamadas de usurios confiveis. Para isso, foram feitas anlises em trs comunidades online de perguntas e respostas da Web visando explorar suas caractersticas para tornar possvel a elaborao da nova mtrica. A mtrica proposta chamada de ndice de Confiana.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Online communities of questions and answers became important places for users to get information and share knowledge. We investigated a new metric that allows the identification of people that are willing to help and provide good answers in a community, which we call the reliable users. We analyzed three online communities of questions and answers aiming to explore its features and then propose a new metric. Our new metric is called Reliability Index.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Plataforma Mignone: Uma Arquitetura para Ambientes Virtuais e um Modelo para Construo de Objetos de Aprendizagem Especializados para Educao Musical
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Mignone Platform: An Architecture for Virtual Environments and a Model for Building Learning Objects that are Specialized for Music Education

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Congresso Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao (CBIE) - Concurso de Teses e Dissertaes em Informtica na Educao (CTD-IE)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais dos Workshops do Congresso Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Atualmente, h um grande contraste entre as funcionalidades desejadas por alunos de msica e as oferecidas por tecnologias para este fim. Com o objetivo de minimizar esta diferena, proposta a Plataforma Mignone. Ela constituda por uma arquitetura formal para o desenvolvimento de ambientes virtuais e de um modelo para criao facilitada de objetos (e atividades) de aprendizagem, ambos especializados para a rea da msica. Um estudo de caso foi realizado com 27 alunos do ensino mdio de uma escola pblica no Rio de Janeiro. A partir de anlises quantitativas e qualitativas, foi possvel concluir que o oferecimento de recursos multimdia e sociais, estimulados pelo uso da Plataforma Mignone como guia tanto na construo do ambiente quanto na dos objetos de aprendizagem, influenciam indiretamente na aceitao de ambientes virtuais de aprendizagem para Educao Musical pelos alunos.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nowadays, there is a huge contrast between the features desired by music students and those offered by educational software. In order to minimize this contrast, the Mignone Platform is proposed. It is composed by a software architecture for virtual learning environments and a model that makes the creation of learning objects (and activities) easier, both specialized for Music Education. A case study was performed with 27 students from a public high school at Rio de Janeiro, which used a prototype to perform the learning activities that were built according to the Mignone Platform. The aim of the case study was to verify the students? acceptance of the Mignone Platform. From quantitative and qualitative analysis, it was possible to notice that the use of social and multimedia resources, stimulated by the use of the Mignone Platform, has an indirect influence on the students acceptance of virtual learning environments for Music Education.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Desafios na Formao de Professores em Informtica na Educao no Brasil
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Challenges in the Teacher's Formation in Computers and Education in Brazil

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: Workshop de Desafios da Computao Aplicada Educao (DesafIE!)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais do XXXIV Congresso da Sociedade Brasileira de Computao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Como agente organizador e facilitador da aprendizagem cabe ao professor incluir em suas prticas o uso das Tecnologias da Informao e Comunicao (TIC), mas isso tem ocorrido de forma tmida e incipiente. Este artigo tem por objetivo discutir os desafios para a melhoria da qualidade da educao a partir da incorporao das TICs na prtica da sala de aula, por meio da formao de professores em Informtica na Educao. Prope-se, para enfrentar o desafio, a criao de um Programa de Mestrado Profissionalizante, em Informtica na Educao, em rede, e na modalidade a distncia. Entende-se que um programa com essas caractersticas pode enfrentar o desafio de forma abrangente, atingir diversos locais do pas e ao mesmo tempo considerar as especificidades regionais, tendo potencial para gerar um impacto positivo na Educao em nvel nacional.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: As organizing agents and learning facilitators, teachers and professors might include, in their practices, the use of Information and Communication Technologies (ICT) to improve learning, but this has been occurring in a very incipient way. This paper discusses the challenges of improving the quality of education through the real incorporation of ICT in classroom practice. This is addressed through a proper formation of teachers in the area of Computers in Education. In order to meet this challenge, we propose the creation of a distance learning, network-based Masters? Program in Computers in Education. A program with such characteristics could meet the challenge in depth, reaching different places of the country whilst respecting regional idiosyncrasies, having a potential for positively affecting Education at a nation-wide level.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: intelliGOV ? compliance verification of service-oriented architectures using a semantic approach
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: intelliGOV ? compliance verification of service-oriented architectures using a semantic approach

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: International Conference on Database and Expert Systems Applications

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Organizations are adopting Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) to simplify system landscape, reduce costs and achieve deadlines. To accomplish these goals, it is necessary to ensure that the architecture and its evolution are compliant with business goals, best practices, legal and regulatory requirements. However, compliance verification of SOA is difficult due to the wide set of domains and the heterogeneity of the elements used to compose a service oriented solution. Although ontologies and rules could provide a solution for this problem, this approach cannot represent and verify a significant set of governance policies. Therefore, we propose intelliGOV, an architecture that gathers data from SOA environment, loads it in an ontology and uses semantic rules and queries to verify compliance. A case study conducted in a global energy company provides evidence of solution expressiveness, low coding demand and independence of methods and tools.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Organizations are adopting Service-Oriented Architecture (SOA) to simplify system landscape, reduce costs and achieve deadlines. To accomplish these goals, it is necessary to ensure that the architecture and its evolution are compliant with business goals, best practices, legal and regulatory requirements. However, compliance verification of SOA is difficult due to the wide set of domains and the heterogeneity of the elements used to compose a service oriented solution. Although ontologies and rules could provide a solution for this problem, this approach cannot represent and verify a significant set of governance policies. Therefore, we propose intelliGOV, an architecture that gathers data from SOA environment, loads it in an ontology and uses semantic rules and queries to verify compliance. A case study conducted in a global energy company provides evidence of solution expressiveness, low coding demand and independence of methods and tools.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Systematic survey on the use of Semantic Web for Learning Virtual Environments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Anais dos Workshops do Congresso Brasileiro de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Com o amadurecimento das tecnologias da Web Semntica e sua disseminao, observam-se diversas propostas de ontologias nos mais variados domnios, inclusive na Educao. Considerando que atualmente h na literatura especializada vrios artigos sobre o uso de ontologias para apoiar a Educao, este trabalho realizou um levantamento sistemtico para mapear tais ontologias no contexto de ambientes virtuais de aprendizagem. Os trabalhos foram classificados de acordo com a tecnologia utilizada bem como o foco das ontologias.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: With the maturing of Semantic Web technologies and its dissemination, we observe several proposals of ontologies in a wide variety of domains, including in education. Noticing that currently there are several papers on the specialized literature about the use of ontologies to support education, a systematic survey was conducted in this work to map ontologies in the context of virtual learning environments. The works were classified according to the used technology as well as the ontologies? focus.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Finding Topical Experts in Question & Answer Communities
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Finding Topical Experts in Question & Answer Communities

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: IEEE International Conference on Advanced Learning Technologies (ICALT2016)
DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DOS-ANAIS-OU-PROCEEDINGS: Proceedings of the XVI IEEE International Conference on Advanced Learning Technologies (ICALT2016)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Question and Answer (Q&A) communities (such as Stackoverflow) have become important places for information exchange and knowledge creation. Their success relies predominantly on two aspects of the feedback generated by their members: quality and speed. Of these, the former reflects on the reputation of the community, whilst the latter is indicative of the efficiency of the Q&A system to correctly answer a given question. In this paper, we present a three phase study for identifying and recommending topical experts in Q&A communities. The first phase investigates the most relevant criteria for identifying reputable members of the community (often experts in a given field); the second phase introduces an approach based on semantic annotations to ascertain their area of specialism; and the last phase presents a method to recommend experts to answer questions in their areas of expertise. Our evaluation (carried out using real-world data from the Biology Stack Exchange Q&A community) shows that the numbers of answers provided by each member can be used as reliable indicators of expertise, and semantic annotations can be successfully used to identify the topics in which they specialize. Furthermore, on average, 74% of the recommendations suggested by our method were successful.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Question and Answer (Q&A) communities (such as Stackoverflow) have become important places for information exchange and knowledge creation. Their success relies predominantly on two aspects of the feedback generated by their members: quality and speed. Of these, the former reflects on the reputation of the community, whilst the latter is indicative of the efficiency of the Q&A system to correctly answer a given question. In this paper, we present a three phase study for identifying and recommending topical experts in Q&A communities. The first phase investigates the most relevant criteria for identifying reputable members of the community (often experts in a given field); the second phase introduces an approach based on semantic annotations to ascertain their area of specialism; and the last phase presents a method to recommend experts to answer questions in their areas of expertise. Our evaluation (carried out using real-world data from the Biology Stack Exchange Q&A community) shows that the numbers of answers provided by each member can be used as reliable indicators of expertise, and semantic annotations can be successfully used to identify the topics in which they specialize. Furthermore, on average, 74% of the recommendations suggested by our method were successful.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO: Improving the Efficiency of Web Searches in Collaborative Learning Platforms
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-INGLES: Improving the Efficiency of Web Searches in Collaborative Learning Platforms

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO.NOME-DO-EVENTO: World Summit on the Knowledge Society (WSKS 2011)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The web is nowadays one of the main information sources and information searching is one important issue where many advances have been reported. However, in learning environments, web searches do not consider the learning context in order to provide more adequate learning content. As collaborative learning platforms are usually web-based systems, it would be important to add a contextual web query tool to provide additional learning material from the web. This paper describes a strategy for incorporating such functionality in online social networks, as they can be used as collaborative learning platforms. In this study, the learning environment was a learning community in an online social network, in which a course was implemented. Contextual search was provided through a prototype that implements the proposed query expansion, which was evaluated using learning documents. Some results are summarized and presented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The web is nowadays one of the main information sources and information searching is one important issue where many advances have been reported. However, in learning environments, web searches do not consider the learning context in order to provide more adequate learning content. As collaborative learning platforms are usually web-based systems, it would be important to add a contextual web query tool to provide additional learning material from the web. This paper describes a strategy for incorporating such functionality in online social networks, as they can be used as collaborative learning platforms. In this study, the learning environment was a learning community in an online social network, in which a course was implemented. Contextual search was provided through a prototype that implements the proposed query expansion, which was evaluated using learning documents. Some results are summarized and presented.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Formao Permanente e Outras Atividades de Ensino, Inclusive Educao Distncia e Educao Especial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Internet has promoted several changes in the world. In this scenario, new theories, paradigms and methodologies have been discussed in the education area. In addition, as the development of learning material is expensive and time consuming, the use of Learning Objects (LO) has been proposed for improving content reuse. However, the emphasis has been on how to describe LO, but it is not clear how to develop them. In addition, people want to satisfy their learning needs according to their personal characteristics such as knowledge background and learning style. The work presented in this paper proposes the increase of LO semantics. The idea behind our proposal is to develop LO based on a model for structuring knowledge (concepts, demonstrations and interactions) according to their context, representation and composition. This approach enables increased reusability and adaptability while providing better structured content material.

W.;Siqueira, Sean W.M.;Sean W.M. Siqueira;Siqueira, Sean Wolfgand Matsui;Matsui Siqueira, S. W.;Matsui Siqueira, Sean Wolfgand

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Abstract: Purpose ? This paper seeks to present a modeling approach for e-learning content, describing how to structure e-learning content and also represent it in OWL DL. Design/methodology/approach ? This paper presents three different layers of information that should be considered in e-learning and conceptual models to guide the representation of e-learning content. This proposal is based on existing standards and experience gained in previous works. It is also shown how to structure and represent the content embedded in learning objects (LOs). Findings ? Besides providing a better structuring of the e-learning content, content reuse and exploratory navigations over content through the semantic relationships between information (mainly information objects (IOs) and conceptual units) are promoted. Research limitations/implications ? A visual tool to allow a better exploration of the e-learning content is already being developed. However, it is essential to develop optimized storing and retrieving mechanisms that would make this approach more interesting. Practical implications ? When compared with other approaches such as those based on semantic models and deductive models, the decrease in complexity makes acceptance and adoption of this approach by teachers and instructional designers easier. Originality/value ? This paper fulfils an identified three-level information need for e-learning content and presents a new modeling approach. Besides structuring the e-learning content, the model is also represented in OWL DL. It allows an easier/richer implementation of e-learning content.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Navigational Exploration of Learning Content
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Navigational Exploration of Learning Content

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Scientia (Unisinos)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The development of educational content material is expensive and time-consuming, leading to a need for reusable content. Institutions are establishing partnerships in order to share content and services as well as to define and be compliant to standards. In this context, Learning Objects (LOs) and standard metadata have been grown in acceptance and use. However, the idea behind what a LO really is and how it should be developed and reused is still not consensual. Several developers still consider that LOs are semantically dense and difficult to reuse. Another important issue is related to content exploration that is limited to searches over keywords and through the access of metadata. In this paper, a metamodel for structuring and representing learning content is presented, emphasizing the content semantics and its relationships, and providing a mechanism for learning through content exploration. The approach presented in this paper considers small portions of the usual LOs as the atomic elements while providing mechanisms for structuring their relationships and context (metadata). Thus, besides separating content and context, the proposed approach presents a conceptual guidance for developing semantically richer LOs. Then, the student could explore the content on demand or through previously defined paths. The metamodel is implemented using an ontology language, which provides a formal structure for defining pieces of information. A specialization of the metamodel is also proposed, based on previous works on information and knowledge processing. Finally, a case study aims at making the understanding of the work proposed in this paper easier.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Cataloguing and Searching Musical Sound Recordings in an Ontology-Based Information System
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Cataloguing and Searching Musical Sound Recordings in an Ontology-Based Information System

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Knowledge Society Research

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Although a lot of information is available worldwide, getting the right piece of information is challenging. In addition, integrating information from different sources is still very complicated. To make the different information systems to interoperate, it is necessary to provide common knowledge structures. Ontologies have been developed for making the semantics of a domain explicit. However, using such formal structures is not straightforward and their benefits are not clear to the users. The work presented in this paper explores the use of an ontology for musical sound recordings in order to allow cataloguing and searching for such information. Therefore it investigates how the knowledge society can benefit from ontologies, with focus on the culture, more specifically the music domain. Some possible benefits and pitfalls are also described and a case study shows an evaluation of the proposed approach by users of this domain.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Improving Software Agent Communication with Structural Ontology Alignment Methods
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Improving Software Agent Communication with Structural Ontology Alignment Methods

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Information Technology and Web Engineering

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: To perform tasks on the semantic web, software agents must be able to communicate with other agents using domain ontologies, even when considering different ontologies. In this regard, it is necessary to address semantic interoperability to enable agents to recognize common concepts and misunderstandings. In this paper, the authors propose the use of negotiation concepts in business scenarios for addressing concept compatibilization problems in communication between software agents and present an algorithm developed in the GNoSIS system. A validation of this approach is presented.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Computers in Human Behavior

AUTORES.NOME-COMPLETO-DO-AUTOR: Rodrigues, Diva de S. e S.
AUTORES.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: Rodrigues, Diva de S. e S.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The development of instructional content using Information Technologies is an expensive, time-consuming and complex process that requires new methodologies. It was in this context that the concept of Learning Objects (LOs) was proposed in order to promote reuse. However, this goal is not yet fully attained and new contributions to increase reuse are still welcome. Besides, if content is conveyed in LOs that are easier to reuse, they must be combined and sequenced in order to build more elaborated and complex content. This paper presents a strategy to deal with these problems based on the definition of small LOs here called Component Objects (COs). These COs are structured and combined according to a conceptual metamodel, which is the basis for the definition of conceptual schemas representing the existing material, including not only content but also practice. This strategy for searching, extracting, and sequencing COs, supports a teacher to better control the implementation of complex content, reducing errors in the authoring process. This approach includes a specification language and an algorithm for semi-automatic sequencing learning content and practice. Finally, a case study that shows the proposed approach and some results of using the algorithm are presented.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The development of instructional content using Information Technologies is an expensive, time-consuming and complex process that requires new methodologies. It was in this context that the concept of Learning Objects (LOs) was proposed in order to promote reuse. However, this goal is not yet fully attained and new contributions to increase reuse are still welcome. Besides, if content is conveyed in LOs that are easier to reuse, they must be combined and sequenced in order to build more elaborated and complex content. This paper presents a strategy to deal with these problems based on the definition of small LOs here called Component Objects (COs). These COs are structured and combined according to a conceptual metamodel, which is the basis for the definition of conceptual schemas representing the existing material, including not only content but also practice. This strategy for searching, extracting, and sequencing COs, supports a teacher to better control the implementation of complex content, reducing errors in the authoring process. This approach includes a specification language and an algorithm for semi-automatic sequencing learning content and practice. Finally, a case study that shows the proposed approach and some results of using the algorithm are presented.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Using Concept Maps and Ontology Alignment for Learning Assessment
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Using Concept Maps and Ontology Alignment for Learning Assessment

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IEEE Multidisciplinary Engineering Education Magazine

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Concept Maps are the main tool of the constructivist theory of Meaningful Learning. Just like domain ontologies, concept maps enable clarification of concepts and relationships of a domain. This article presents a learning assessment model supported by the use of concept maps and ontology alignment techniques, respectively for clarification of the organization of concepts in the student's cognitive structure and for the automatic comparison of these maps with a reference ontology. An example illustrating this application is presented and discussed.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Concept Maps are the main tool of the constructivist theory of Meaningful Learning. Just like domain ontologies, concept maps enable clarification of concepts and relationships of a domain. This article presents a learning assessment model supported by the use of concept maps and ontology alignment techniques, respectively for clarification of the organization of concepts in the student's cognitive structure and for the automatic comparison of these maps with a reference ontology. An example illustrating this application is presented and discussed.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Semantic Recommendation of Bibliographical References: an Experience with Master Science?s Degree Students
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Semantic Recommendation of Bibliographical References: an Experience with Master Science?s Degree Students

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: IEEE Multidisciplinary Engineering Education Magazine

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: This paper presents a proposal of a recommendation system of academic references for graduate students and researchers to use as a reading guide. The proposed approach analyzes the similarity of students' search criteria and information about their profile with academic references metadata. The recommendation approach is implemented through semantic technologies for storing references and students' profiles in an interoperable format, allowing their reuse. A case study was conducted using a simplified prototype. An ontology was developed for testing the characteristics to be evaluated on this work such as semantic storage of references/profiles and use of students' preferences in the recommendation logic. Results suggest that the proposed recommendation mechanism, based on the use of ontologies, achieved good levels of acceptance by users and also indicate that references recommendation systems for graduate (masters science degree, in this case), are perceived as useful tools by students.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: This paper presents a proposal of a recommendation system of academic references for graduate students and researchers to use as a reading guide. The proposed approach analyzes the similarity of students' search criteria and information about their profile with academic references metadata. The recommendation approach is implemented through semantic technologies for storing references and students' profiles in an interoperable format, allowing their reuse. A case study was conducted using a simplified prototype. Results suggest that the proposed recommendation mechanism, based on the use of ontologies, achieved good levels of acceptance by users and also indicate that references recommendation systems for graduate (masters science degree, in this case), are perceived as useful tools by students.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Abordagens de Utilizao de Segmentos de Objetos de Aprendizagem
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Approaches for Using Learning Objects' Segments

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: O desenvolvimento de materiais instrucionais no contexto da Educao Baseada na Web, principalmente aqueles que incorporam caractersticas multimdias, considerado caro e demorado, o que justifica a abordagem de reutilizao. Assim, o uso conjunto de Objetos de Aprendizagem (OAs) e seus respectivos metadados tem sido amplamente adotado apesar de muitos usurios demonstrarem dificuldades em utilizar e reutilizar tais OAs, principalmente se o interesse est restrito a partes especficas do contedo destes materiais. Logo, a tendncia que os mesmos fiquem cada vez menores, pois quanto mais granulares estiverem os contedos, mais facilmente ser possvel reutiliz-los em diferentes contextos educacionais. Uma proposta para permitir o acesso e o reuso de partes especficas de seus contedos prover uma descrio estruturada de tais partes ? configurando-as como segmentos de informao. Assim, este artigo descreve uma arquitetura e sistemtica para representar o contedo de OAs em um nvel mais granular, propondo sua estruturao em segmentos de informao reutilizveis. Algumas abordagens de utilizao de tais segmentos so propostas e avaliadas atravs de um estudo de caso, a saber: composio de segmentos; uso de modelos de contedo na descrio de segmentos; uso de segmentos em um cenrio de aprendizagem colaborativa e explorao de inferncias lgicas atravs de regras e relacionamentos estabelecidos entre segmentos.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Representao da Estruturao de Segmentos de Objetos de Aprendizagem Multimdia: Uma Abordagem Baseada em Meta-modelos de Contedo
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Representation of the Structuring of Multimedia Learning Objects Segmentation: An Approach Based on Content Meta-Models

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: No contexto de e-learning, o desenvolvimento de materiais de aprendizagem, principalmente os que incorporam multimdia, visto como um processo caro e demorado. Assim, h um enfoque na reutilizao, que obtida atravs da abordagem de orientao a objetos, resultando nos Objetos de Aprendizagem (OAs). Entretanto, atualmente, OAs so estruturados como arquivos multimdia e, portanto, seu reuso se d como um todo, limitando seu aproveitamento e o retorno de investimento sobre seu desenvolvimento. Por outro lado, observa-se que vrios OAs multimdia j foram desenvolvidos e um esforo em refaz-los seria invivel. Alm disso, OAs so agrupados no intuito de formar aulas e/ou cursos e a semntica aplicada a este agrupamento, bem como a semntica aplicada na construo dos prprios OAs se perde, dificultando o compartilhamento de materiais instrucionais entre diferentes desenvolvedores de contedo, grupos de pesquisa ou instituies. Neste sentido, o trabalho apresentado neste artigo prope uma representao da estrutura de segmentao do contedo presente nos OAs existentes. De modo a permitir o compartilhamento destes OAs e o reuso dos segmentos segundo a estruturao de seu contedo, meta-modelos de contedos guiam a segmentao e so representados em OWL, a linguagem para ontologias definida como padro pelo W3C. Entretanto, como diferentes meta-modelos podem ser definidos por diferentes grupos de usurio, mapeamentos entre os prprios meta-modelos e entre contedos e outros meta-modelos devem ser considerados. A arquitetura de representao desta segmentao de OAs baseada em meta-modelos de contedo apresentada neste artigo e um prottipo e um estudo de caso apresentam a funcionalidade da arquitetura proposta.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In technology enhanced learning, the development of learning materials, mainly the ones that incorporate multimedia, is seen as an expensive and time-consuming process. Thus, there is a focus on reuse, which is obtained through the object-oriented approach, resulting in the Learning Objects (LOs). However, nowadays, LOs are structured as multimedia files and, therefore, the reuse implies on using the whole file, which limits its use and the return on investment of its development. However, many multimedia LOs have already been developed and the effort in remaking them would not be viable. Besides, LOs are grouped in order to form lessons and courses and the semantic applied to this grouping as well as the semantic applied to the development of LOs is forgotten, which makes difficult sharing learning materials between different instructional designers, research groups or institutions. So, the work presented in this paper proposes a representation of the segmentation structure of the content embedded in existing LOs. In order to allow sharing theses LOs and reusing segments according to the their content structure, content meta-models guide the segmentation and are represented in OWL, the ontology language defined by W3C. However, as different meta-models can be defined by different users? groups, meta-models mappings as well as mapping between learning content and others meta-models should be considered. The architecture for representing the LOs? segmentation based on content meta-models is presented in this paper and a prototype and a case study present the functionality of the proposed architecture.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Reconhecimento e Agrupamento de Objetos de Aprendizagem Semelhantes
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Recognizing and Grouping Similar Learning Objects

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Atualmente, educao a distncia, em especial a educao baseada na web, est se tornando mais importante na medida em que possibilita a disseminao de conhecimento e informao atravs da Internet de modo mais rpido e barato. Consequentemente, arquiteturas para sistemas de aprendizagem tm sido desenvolvidas e de modo a filtrar o que mais relevante e/ou de interesse dos usurios, tcnicas de personalizao tm sido propostas e utilizadas. Em sistemas de aprendizagem, acesso ao contedo instrucional sempre uma caracterstica importante e a possibilidade de filtrar o contedo armazenado nestes repositrios um aspecto essencial. Neste contexto, o trabalho descrito neste artigo enfoca o problema de reconhecer diferentes verses do mesmo contedo. Se diferentes verses so reconhecidas, ento podem ser organizadas de acordo com diferentes caractersticas e possvel selecionar automaticamente a verso que melhor se adequa s necessidades do usurio. Este artigo descreve um servio web ? Servio Agrupador de Resultados (objetos de aprendizagem) Semelhantes ? que foi especificado para ser capaz de reconhecer verses de objetos de aprendizagem existentes baseados em seus registros de metadados. Um estudo de caso descrito, em que as idias apresentadas so ilustradas.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Busca Contextualizada Enriquecida com Dados Abertos para Apoiar a Aprendizagem Colaborativa em Redes Sociais
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Busca Contextualizada Enriquecida com Dados Abertos para Apoiar a Aprendizagem Colaborativa em Redes Sociais

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Com o desenvolvimento das tecnologias de informao e comunicao, em especial a Web e sistemas colaborativos, observa-se um amplo acesso a motores de busca e redes sociais. Este trabalho considera que a relevncia na recuperao de documentos na Web pode ser primordial para estimular a colaborao em dinmicas de aprendizagem baseadas em discusso. Para melhorar e contextualizar a recuperao de documentos na Web, este artigo prope: (i) a modelagem do contexto a partir da extrao das mensagens em grupos de rede social e (ii) uso do contexto para melhorar a relevncia na recuperao de documentos na Web. Um estudo de caso demonstrou que a captura do contexto enriquecido usando mensagens de discusso pode melhorar a relevncia dos resultados das buscas na Web e contribuir com as discusses.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: With the development of information and communication technologies, in special the Web and collaborative systems, there is a broad access to query engines and social networks. This work considers the relevance in documents retrieval on the Web can be important to encourage collaborative learning dynamics based on discussion. To improve and contextualize the documents retrieval on the Web, this paper proposes: (i) the context modeling from the extraction of messages in social networking groups and (ii) use of the context to improve the relevance in the documents retrieval on the Web. A case study showed the enriched context capture using the discussion messages can improve the relevance of search results on the Web and contribute to the discussions.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Music students' behavior on using learning objects closer to the domain characteristics and the social reality
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Music students' behavior on using learning objects closer to the domain characteristics and the social reality

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Computers in Human Behavior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In this paper we analyze the behavior of music students on using learning objects that are closer to the domain characteristics and to the learners? digital social reality. A model for supporting the development of the learning objects with these characteristics is described and case study was conducted with high school students considering a music activity that was created using the proposed model in order to demonstrate the applicability and benefits of our approach. Results show the importance of considering the proposed model on guiding courseware development for education, especially on the music education context. Moreover, we noticed that the students seemed to be more motivated when using social and sound manipulation integrated resources because of their perception of learning opportunities, social influence, ease of use, hedonic motivation, facilitating conditions and usage intention.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In this paper we analyze the behavior of music students on using learning objects that are closer to the domain characteristics and to the learners? digital social reality. A model for supporting the development of the learning objects with these characteristics is described and case study was conducted with high school students considering a music activity that was created using the proposed model in order to demonstrate the applicability and benefits of our approach. DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Structuring the discourse on social networks for learning: Case studies on blogs and microblogs
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Structuring the discourse on social networks for learning: Case studies on blogs and microblogs

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Computers in Human Behavior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Nowadays social networks have a prominent function in human communication. In addition, their use in the context of formal learning can contribute to increase student?s interactions. These interactions can be better supported with the right structure for the messages. This paper presents an investigation on the structure of messages on blogs and microblogs, two different categories of social networks. Usually, blogs are author-based (also called content-based or push-based) social networks while microblogs are reader-based (also called contact-based or pull-based) social networks. This categorization of social networks is explained and some characteristics of messages? structuring on such social networks are described. Structuring messages is investigated in both categories of social networks in case studies on a collaborative learning context. The results show the importance of using both categories of social networks in learning activities and also provide interesting results on message structuring.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nowadays social networks have a prominent function in human communication. In addition, their use in the context of formal learning can contribute to increase student?s interactions. These interactions can be better supported with the right structure for the messages. This paper presents an investigation on the structure of messages on blogs and microblogs, two different categories of social networks. The results show the importance of using both categories of social networks in learning activities and also provide interesting results on message structuring.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Contextual web searches in Facebook using learning materials and discussion messages
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Contextual web searches in Facebook using learning materials and discussion messages

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Computers in Human Behavior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The web is nowadays one of the main information sources, and information search is an important area in which many advances have been registered. One approach to improve web search results is to consider contextual information. Usually, information about context has been provided through user logs on previous searches or the monitoring of clicks on first results, but different approaches can be used in specific environments. In a web based learning environment, existing documents and exchanged messages could provide contextual information. So, the main goal of this work is to provide a contextual web search engine based on shared documents and messages posted in a social network used for collaborative learning. Contextual search is provided through query expansion using learning documents (material provided by the teacher) and discussion messages (posts, links and comments that result from the participants? interactions). A prototype was implemented and used in a learning scenario to acquire the context in a learning community. The proposed approach makes the context acquisition faster and more dynamic as it considers an automatic approach over text processing of documents and discussions. In addition, the results of the query engine with and without the contextual information were compared and the proposed approach using contextual information showed improvements in the precision of the results.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: YouFlow Microblog
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: YouFlow Microblog

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Interactive Technology and Smart Education

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Microblogs have been used in the educational context, but differently from following friends? status messages, in the educational scenario it is important to follow the discussions, to understand the flow of messages. YouFlow microblog was developed for that purpose and provides the main structures of discourse that are available on communication systems as well as messages' categorization according to a lesson plan. An explanatory case study was performed with Information Systems students and showed an increase in the participation on discussions of topics according to a lesson plan as well as the importance of filtering and searching messages. YouFlow microblog and the collaborative learning approach based on discussions motivated students and provided good learning achievements.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Finding Experts on Facebook Communities:
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Finding Experts on Facebook Communities:

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: International Journal of Knowledge Society Research

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Online communities have become important places for users to share information. In this context, the work described in this article aims to analyze computational methods that could allow us to identify users with the highest expertise levels on a specific knowledge domain in an online community. In this study the authots extracted data from a Java discussion group from an online community - Facebook, captured some important information and represented the community as a graph. Then, the authors compared the Bow-tie structure of this community with the ones from the Web and from a forum that are described in the literature. In addition, the authors tested some graph metrics and algorithms in order to analyze if they could provide a method to find the experts in this online community. The results show that four of the tested metrics can indicate if a user is an expert or not.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Online communities have become important places for users to share information. In this context, the work described in this article aims to analyze computational methods that could allow us to identify users with the highest expertise levels on a specific knowledge domain in an online community. In this study the authots extracted data from a Java discussion group from an online community - Facebook, captured some important information and represented the community as a graph. Then, the authors compared the Bow-tie structure of this community with the ones from the Web and from a forum that are described in the literature. In addition, the authors tested some graph metrics and algorithms in order to analyze if they could provide a method to find the experts in this online community. The results show that four of the tested metrics can indicate if a user is an expert or not.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Plataforma Mignone: Ambiente Virtual de Aprendizagem e Objetos de Aprendizagem Especializados para a Educao Musical
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Plataforma Mignone: Ambiente Virtual de Aprendizagem e Objetos de Aprendizagem Especializados para a Educao Musical

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Revista Brasileira de Informtica na Educao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Atualmente, h uma demanda por recursos multimdia e sociais de forma integrada em ambientes de aprendizagem, o que uma necessidade ainda maior na Educao Musical. Neste artigo descrevemos as particularidades da Educao Musical e apresentamos a Plataforma Mignone. Esta plataforma constituda por uma arquitetura formal para o desenvolvimento de ambientes virtuais e de um modelo para criao facilitada de objetos (e atividades) de aprendizagem, ambos especializados para a rea da msica. Aqui detalhamos as diretrizes que guiam a construo do ambiente, bem como apresentamos mais detalhes do estudo de caso que foi realizado com 27 alunos do ensino mdio de uma escola pblica no Rio de Janeiro. A partir de anlises quantitativas e qualitativas, foi possvel concluir que o oferecimento de recursos multimdia e sociais, estimulados pelo uso da Plataforma Mignone como guia tanto na construo do ambiente quanto na dos objetos de aprendizagem, influenciam indiretamente na aceitao de ambientes virtuais de aprendizagem para Educao Musical pelos alunos.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Nowadays, there is a great demand for multimedia and social resources in an integrated way in learning environments, which is a still bigger need for Music Education. In this scientific article we describe the particularities of Music Education and present the Mignone Platform. This platform is composed of a formal architecture for supporting the development of virtual learning environments and a model that makes easier the creation of learning objects (and activities), both the architecture and the model are specialized for the Music knowledge area. Here we detail the guidelines that guide the construction of the environment and we also present more details on the case study that was performed with 27 students from a public high school at Rio de Janeiro, which used a prototype to perform the learning activities that were built according to the Mignone Platform. The aim of the case study was to verify the students? acceptance of the Mignone Platform. From quantitative and qualitative analysis, it was possible to notice that the use of social and multimedia resources, stimulated by the use of the Mignone Platform, has an indirect influence on the students? acceptance of virtual learning environments for Music Education.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: How to find people who can help to answer a question? - Analyses of metrics and machine learning in online communities
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: How to find people who can help to answer a question? - Analyses of metrics and machine learning in online communities

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: Computers in Human Behavior

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Online communities have become important places for users to exchange information and build knowledge. In these communities, people ask and answer questions, learn with each other, but some problems may occur such as not getting an answer or getting contradictory ones. In order to increase the responsiveness of the communities, it would be important to identify people who are willing to help and who provide good answers in such communities, whom we call reliable users. We investigated various components of online communities and users? attributes looking for a correlation between these characteristics and the users? reputation in these communities. After that, we proposed the usage of two machine learning techniques, artificial neural network and clustering algorithm, with the users? attributes for finding reliable sources. The results show that the usage of an artificial neural network is a good approach as around 90% of the users were correctly identified while the clustering algorithm makes to find groups of reliable users more easily.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Online communities have become important places for users to exchange information and build knowledge. In these communities, people ask and answer questions, learn with each other, but some problems may occur such as not getting an answer or getting contradictory ones. In order to increase the responsiveness of the communities, it would be important to identify people who are willing to help and who provide good answers in such communities, whom we call reliable users. We investigated various components of online communities and users? attributes looking for a correlation between these characteristics and the users? reputation in these communities. After that, we proposed the usage of two machine learning techniques, artificial neural network and clustering algorithm, with the users? attributes for finding reliable sources. The results show that the usage of an artificial neural network is a good approach as around 90% of the users were correctly identified while the clustering algorithm makes to find groups of reliable users more easily.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO: Anlise de abordagens populacionais para meta-alinhamento de ontologias
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-ARTIGO-INGLES: Analysis of populational approaches for meta-alignment of ontologies

DETALHAMENTO-DO-ARTIGO.TITULO-DO-PERIODICO-OU-REVISTA: iSys: Revista Brasileira de Sistemas de Informao

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: A interoperabilidade um requisito importante em um ambiente de sistemas de informao, destacando-se a interoperabilidade semntica. Ontologias tem sido utilizadas para promover a interoperabilidade semntica, mas num ambiente onde coexistem mais de uma ontologia, necessria a utilizao de tcnicas que permitam alinhar as diferentes ontologias para permitir a troca de informao entre os sistemas. Dentre as tcnicas de alinhamento mais atuais, est o meta-alinhamento de ontologias, o qual permite a agregao e autoconfigurao de alinhadores. A escolha por uma abordagem de meta-alinhamento no trivial e faz-se necessrio analisar diferentes caractersticas das solues. Esse trabalho apresenta e compara as abordagens de atuais meta-alinhamento de ontologias, apontando suas qualidades e deficincias.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Interoperability is an important requirement in information systems, mainly the semantic interoperability. Ontologies have been used for reaching semantic interoperability, but when systems use two or more ontologies it is necessary the consider techniques that allow aligning distinct ontologies . Ontology meta-matching (OMM) is a recent approach for ontology alignment. OMM addresses issues such as aligner aggregation and self-configuration. The choice of a good OMM approach is not trivial and it is necessary to analyze the characteristics of the solutions. In this work, we detail and compare the more recent OMM approaches and analyze their differences.

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The proper use and dissemination of information among stakeholders, organizations, and societies is crucial for the development of productive and prosperous communities.
Governance, Communication, and Innovation in a Knowledge Intensive Society gathers current research on knowledge management in governments, organizations, and institutions, and presents a compilation useful to academics, professionals, politicians, and policy makers invested in knowledge-intensive societies. This book investigates the impact of knowledge and information technologies on fields as diverse as education, culture, science and business, in order to provide an effective framework for effectively navigating the nuances of an information-pervasive world.

This book investigates the impact of knowledge and information technologies on fields as diverse as education, culture, science and business, in order to provide an effective framework for effectively navigating the nuances of an information-pervasive world.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Providing Information from Brazilian Politicians using Linked Data
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Providing Information from Brazilian Politicians using Linked Data

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Cases on Open-Linked Data and Semantic Web Applications
DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.ORGANIZADORES: Patricia Ordoez de Pablos; Miltiadis D. Lytras; Robert Tennyson; Jose Emilio Labra Gayo

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Since its inception, the Web has undergone continuous evolution in order to improve itself as a mean of global communication and information sharing. Open Government Data are increasingly being published on the Web, contributing to the transparency and the reusability of public data. At the same time, the use of Linked Data has been increasing in recent years, enabling the development of better and smarter applications. This chapter presents a case on the publication of Open Government Data using the Linked Data practices, by creating a data set of Brazilian politicians with information collected from different sources. This is the first dataset providing Brazilian linked data.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Since its inception, the Web has undergone continuous evolution in order to improve itself as a mean of global communication and information sharing. Open Government Data are increasingly being published on the Web, contributing to the transparency and the reusability of public data. At the same time, the use of Linked Data has been increasing in recent years, enabling the development of better and smarter applications. This chapter presents a case on the publication of Open Government Data using the Linked Data practices, by creating a data set of Brazilian politicians with information collected from different sources. This is the first dataset providing Brazilian linked data.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Applying Ontology Similarity Functions to Improve Software Agent Communication
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Applying Ontology Similarity Functions to Improve Software Agent Communication

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Models for Capitalizing on Web Engineering Advancements

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In order to perform its tasks on the Semantic Web, software agents must be able to communicate with other agents using domain ontologies, even when considering different ontologies. Thus, it?s necessary to address the semantic interoperability issue to enable agents to recognize common concepts and misunderstandings. This work proposes the use of GNoSIS, a tool for composing ontology similarity functions, and specific modules in Goddard agent architecture in order for software agents to negotiate meanings of terms not defined in its ontology.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In order to perform its tasks on the Semantic Web, software agents must be able to communicate with other agents using domain ontologies, even when considering different ontologies. Thus, it?s necessary to address the semantic interoperability issue to enable agents to recognize common concepts and misunderstandings. This work proposes the use of GNoSIS, a tool for composing ontology similarity functions, and specific modules in Goddard agent architecture in order for software agents to negotiate meanings of terms not defined in its ontology.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO: Bringing Semantics to Aspect-Oriented Business Process Management
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-CAPITULO-DO-LIVRO-INGLES: Bringing Semantics to Aspect-Oriented Business Process Management

DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.TITULO-DO-LIVRO: Lecture Notes in Business Information Processing
DETALHAMENTO-DO-CAPITULO.ORGANIZADORES: Niels Lohmann; Minseok Song; Petia Wohed

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: In software development, crosscutting concerns, such as security, audit, access control, authentication, logging, persistence, transaction and error handling, can be modularized using aspect-oriented approaches, which can also benefit the business process from the reduction in complexity. Literature refers to techniques that address aspects on process implementation and modeling. However, they adopt different semantic representation of aspects and related elements, making it difficult to provide integration between these phases of the business process lifecycle. This paper aims at addressing the issue of crosscutting concerns during the lifecycle of a business process with an approach based on an ontology for aspect-orientation and a semantic service invocation. Our main contribution is a bridge for the semantic gap between the modeling and implementation steps of aspect-oriented business processes.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: In software development, crosscutting concerns, such as security, audit, access control, authentication, logging, persistence, transaction and error handling, can be modularized using aspect-oriented approaches, which can also benefit the business process from the reduction in complexity. Literature refers to techniques that address aspects on process implementation and modeling. However, they adopt different semantic representation of aspects and related elements, making it difficult to provide integration between these phases of the business process lifecycle. This paper aims at addressing the issue of crosscutting concerns during the lifecycle of a business process with an approach based on an ontology for aspect-orientation and a semantic service invocation. Our main contribution is a bridge for the semantic gap between the modeling and implementation steps of aspect-oriented business processes.

W.;Siqueira, Sean W.M.;Sean W.M. Siqueira;Siqueira, Sean Wolfgand Matsui;Matsui Siqueira, S. W.;Matsui Siqueira, Sean Wolfgand

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Formao Permanente e Outras Atividades de Ensino, Inclusive Educao Distncia e Educao Especial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: The Internet has promoted several changes in the world, including on education. People have been more interested in learning, which makes developing higher quality content material even more important. In addition, people want to satisfy their learning needs according to their personal characteristics such as knowledge background and learning style. Therefore, nowadays there is a great interest on reusable learning content material and adaptive systems. Learning metadata standards contribute to achieve such reusability through the idea of learning objects. However, there is no guidance on how to develop learning objects, but only on how to describe them. The work presented in this paper proposes a model for structuring knowledge (concepts, demonstrations and interactions) in learning objects according to their context, representation and composition. This approach enables increased reusability and adaptability while providing better structured material.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-PROCESSOS-OU-TECNICAS.TITULO-DO-PROCESSO: Utilizao de tecnologias semnticas para suportar decises

DETALHAMENTO-DO-PROCESSOS-OU-TECNICAS.INSTITUICAO-FINANCIADORA: Universidade Federal do Estado do Rio de Janeiro (UNIRIO)

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Tcnica de aplicao de tecnologias da Web Semntica para tornar os sistemas de Business Itelligence (BI) mais aderentes ao negcio, desta forma possibilitando a utilizao da semntica do negcio nas atividades de apoio deciso. Atravs da avaliao do exemplo e dos principais conceitos que justificam a utilizao do novo termo BI 2.0, notou-se que tecnologias semnticas podem ser utilizadas para diminuir a latncia de dados com a utilizao de Servios Web Semnticos para tornar mais prximos, atravs da integrao, os ambientes operacionais e ambientes analticos; diminuir a latncia de anlise provendo contedo mais semntico, melhores metadados e um ambiente de BI mais aderente ao negcio; e diminuir a latncia de deciso utilizando o conhecimento para, atravs de inferncias, automatizar ou sugerir decises.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO: IASTED Technical Committee on The Web, Internet, and Multimedia

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.FINALIDADE: Planning and organization of IASTED activities such as meetings and publications
Proposta de Gesto de Ontologias na GDIEP/Petrobras

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Ontologias vm ganhando popularidade, mas suas promessas de soluo para problemas reais e de interoperabilidade no foram ainda realizados. Gesto de ontologias um ponto central desta evoluo, e existem uma falta de estratgias e mecanismos adequados para trat-la de forma a contribuir para o alinhamento mais adequado entre negcio e TI. Este trabalho prope uma abordagem para gesto de ontologia em empresas como parte de uma iniciativa de Arquitetura de Informao. Esta abordagem prov uma fundamentao mais completa do ciclo de vida de ontologia enquanto guia a empresa na sua gesto, pela definio de um conjunto de processos, papis e competncias necessrias para gesto de ontologias.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Ontologies have gained popularity, but its promises of being a key point to the solution of real-world problems and mitigating interoperability problems at a large scale have not yet been accomplished. Ontology management is at the kernel of this evolution, and there is a lack of adequate strategies and mechanisms for handling it in such a way to contribute to a better alignment between business and IT. This work proposes an approach for enterprise ontology management as part of an Information Architecture initiative. This approach provides a more complete foundation of the ontology lifecycle while guiding the enterprise in this management, by defining a set of processes, roles and competencies required for ontology management.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.FINALIDADE: Proposta de gesto de ontologias na GDIEP/Petrobras

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Tecnologias semnticas esto cada vez mais sendo utilizadas em ambientes corporativos, onde ontologias tornam-se mais abrangentes e complexas. Consequentemente, a gesto de ontologias se torna tambm mais complexa, necessitando de ferramentas e metodologias de apoio. No entanto, a grande quantidade de ferramentas desenvolvidas segundo caractersticas especficas dificulta a seleo de ferramentas para a gesto adequada de ontologias. Este trabalho prope uma metodologia para avaliao de ferramentas para gesto de ontologias composta de passos e critrios de pontuao para seleo de ferramentas. A proposta est sendo empregada em um cenrio real, em uma grande empresa brasileira.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: The use of semantic technologies is growing in enterprise IT projects, where ontologies become larger and complex. Consequently, ontology management becomes more complex, requiring tools and methodologies. However, existing tools are developed according with specific characteristics, which turns the choice of an ontology management tool into a big challenge. This article proposes a methodology for evaluating ontology management tools. This methodology is composed by a set of steps for selecting candidate tools and a set of criteria for scoring these tools. This proposal is experimented in a real scenario in a large Brazilian company.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO: Personalizao: Um Estudo no Contexto de Aprendizagem
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO-INGLES: Personalization: A Study in the Context of Learning

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Atualmente h uma certa dificuldade na obteno de informaes que realmente atendam s necessidades especficas dos usurios nos sistemas convencionais de busca. No que se refere personalizao em termos de aprendizagem, verifica-se que um dos principais problemas que os alunos so tratados de maneira uniforme. Neste sentido, a personalizao assume um papel importante na medida em que prov mecanismos para tratar cada aluno/usurio em funo de suas caractersticas, preferncias, nvel de conhecimento, etc. Este estudo tem como objetivo elucidar algumas questes acerca de personalizao, buscando uma nfase maior em termos de personalizao em aprendizagem. Neste sentido, o estudo procura, tambm, destacar alguns dos principais trabalhos da rea.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: Currently there is some difficulty in obtaining information that really meets the specific needs of users in conventional search systems. Regarding customization in terms of learning, one of the main problems is that students are treated uniformly. In this sense, the personalization plays an important role in that it provides mechanisms to deal with each student / user according to his characteristics, preferences, level of knowledge and so forth. This ?survey? aims to elucidate some questions about personalization, seeking a greater emphasis on learning in terms of customization. Accordingly, the study also seeks to highlight some of the main works in this area.

DETALHAMENTO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.FINALIDADE: Proposta de Integrao Semntica de Modelos na GDIEP/Petrobras

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Para a realizao eficiente das suas atividades, essencial que a equipe de administrao de dados (ADs) tenha acesso aos artefatos que permitam conhecer os conceitos sobre o domnio dos dados que esto sob sua responsabilidade. Dentre os artefatos disponveis esto, por exemplo, modelos de processo de negcio e as ontologias de domnio. Este trabalho prope uma abordagem de enriquecimento semntico de modelos de processos, modelos lgicos de dados e esquemas de banco de dados com uma ontologia de domnio atravs de ferramentas conhecidas do mercado.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: For an efficient data administration (DA), the DA team needs to access rich representations of the concepts of the domain of discourse. This is possible through business process models and domain ontologies, for instance. This work proposes an approach for semantic annotation of process models, logical data models, and database schemas, based on a domain ontology. The semantic annotations also made it possible for creating an automatic interface among some common tools used for data and process modeling purposes.

DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO: Anlise de Projeto de Pesquisa como consultor ad hoc da UNOPAR.
BI 2.0 e Web Semntica: Como Lidar com os Problemas de Latncia entre o Evento e a Tomada de Deciso com a Web Semntica
DADOS-BASICOS-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO.TITULO-DO-TRABALHO-TECNICO-INGLES: BI 2.0 and Semantic Web: Dealing with Latency Problems between the event and Decision Making with support of Semantic Web

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Um dos maiores problemas encontrados no Business Intelligence (BI) atual a latncia entre o acontecimento de um evento e a tomada de deciso. Novos conceitos que justificam a utilizao do novo termo BI 2.0 prometem reduzir esta latncia. Neste trabalho, so discutidas as latncias e possveis solues em BI 2.0 a partir de tecnologias relacionadas a Web Semntica. Tal anlise e possveis solues so importantes para incentivar o investimento em aplicaes semnticas nas organizaes e promover o desenvolvimento de BI 2.0, trazendo claros benefcios ao apoio deciso nas organizaes e a sistemas semnticos de informao.
INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS-INGLES: One of the biggest challenges of current Business Intelligence (BI) is the latency from the occurrence of an event until the decision is taken. New concepts that justify the use of the term BI 2.0 promise to reduce such latency. In the work presented in this technical report, the possible latencies are discussed as well as possible solu-tions on BI 2.0, coming from technology related to the Semantic Web. Such analysis and the possible solutions are important to stimulate the investment on semantic applications in the organizations and promote the development of BI 2.0, bringing clear benefits to decision support in the organizations and to semantic information systems.

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Formao Permanente e Outras Atividades de Ensino, Inclusive Educao Distncia e Educao Especial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS: Tutorial apresentado. This Tutorial presents the new challenges raised by the e-Learning application area to the database research community. It presents e-learning as an important application area for Database technology and discusses the existing requirements for storing and managing learning instructional contents. Its main goal is to show that the database research community has much to contribute to the solution of existing problems in e-learning.

W.;Siqueira, Sean W.M.;Sean W.M. Siqueira;Siqueira, Sean Wolfgand Matsui;Matsui Siqueira, S. W.;Matsui Siqueira, Sean Wolfgand

SETORES-DE-ATIVIDADE.SETOR-DE-ATIVIDADE-1: Formao Permanente e Outras Atividades de Ensino, Inclusive Educao Distncia e Educao Especial

INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS.DESCRICAO-INFORMACOES-ADICIONAIS:
The rapid growth on technology-supported learning has led the community of designers and developers of learning resources to a point where they have an enormous variety of tools to help their work. However, these tools usually use proprietary solutions, making it very difficult to reuse the learning content outside the scope of the system where it was created. It is also very difficult to provide a mechanism for searching, accessing and integrating such contents. The use of metadata has been proposed as a solution to this problem.
Addressing specifically the area of e-learning, IEEE Learning Technology Standards Committee (LTSC) is working in a IEEE Specification known as IEEE Learning Object Metadata. In this specification, a Learning Object (LO) is defined as "any entity, digital or non-digital, which can de used, re-used or referenced during technology-supported learning". Examples of LO are instructional content, multimedia content, instructional software, learning objectives, organizations and persons.
The IEEE LOM Base Document was built over proposals from other standards initiatives like IMS Project, the European project ARIADNE and Dublin Core. Besides these initiatives other proposals are emerging like SCORM (Sharable Content Object Reference Model) and EML (Educational Modelling Language). This tutorial presents basic concepts about metadata and its role in searching and accessing information. Discusses the most important and promising initiatives towards setting standards in learning domain, focusing in e-learning. As the syntax language used by many of the proposals is XML, a brief introduction to this language is also presented.
